page.title: 10Experimental Farm in Felton
page.content: Rosemaund Farm was purchased by the Government in 1949 for about Â£150 per hectare. In 1985 there are 176 hectares valued at Â£7000 per hectare. There are 37 people living and working on the site. Rosemaund researches the development of hops, ceeals, legumes, grassland, beef, cattle and sheep. New crops are tested for disease and yields. During the hop harvest in September up to about 1960 some 1,000 men, women and children came to Felton Parish from South Wales and the West MIdlands. Rosemaund in 1985 was the only farm that had migrant labour for hops; 12 men came from South Wales. Hop pickers usually stayed on for cider fruit picking but there is now only one small orchard in Felton.
